Description: Mould-made terracotta lamp. Vertical handle-ornament with vestigial handle at rear. On panelled plinth on the discus, Eros stands cross-legged; beside him a shattered amphora. Handle-ornament shows Nemesis standing, fully draped, winged and with polos and nimbus, holding balance; at her side, a wheel. Angular shoulder with impressed ovules. Base-ring; central raised point. Dark red-brown, micaceous clay. Plaster mould.
Curator's comments: See ‘Jahrbuch des Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts’ XLVI, 1931, pp.187, 214.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2054)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (1032)

Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
